lines.content: Jimbot is your personal jimbo for managing your tasks  ∠( ᐛ 」∠)＿
You can add, delete, list, search and mark all your tasks with Jimbot!
Lighten your mind and go play with Jimbot ♪♪
What can I do for you?
Deadline tasks are tasks that need to be done before a specific date/time.
*You can include either date or time or BOTH (in dd/MM/yyyy HH:mm).
Cool beans~ I've added this task:
You now have 1 tasks in the list!
Event tasks are tasks that start at a specific date/time and end at a specific date/time.
*You can include either date or time or BOTH (in dd/MM/yyyy HH:mm).
Cool beans~ I've added this task:
You now have 2 tasks in the list!
ToDo tasks are tasks without any date/time attached to them.
Cool beans~ I've added this task:
You now have 3 tasks in the list!
Ask Jimbot to show you all the tasks in your list.
*It'll be sorted in chronological order with ToDos at the bottom.
Here are the tasks in your list:
Once you're done with your task, you can ask Jimbot to mark them as such.
If you marked the wrong task, you can simply ask him to unmark it.
Nice♪ I've marked this task as done:
Ogayy, I've marked this task as not done yet:
You now have 2 tasks in the list!
Search for tasks in your list based on their description, or dates!
`find <keyword>` to find tasks that share the same/similar description
`dd/MM/yyyy` or `today` to find tasks on that date/today
Here are the tasks in your list:
Clear your list of all tasks!
(＾∀＾)ゞ I've cleared your tasks! Go play~
Request for the list of commands Jimbot accepts.
Here are the commands you can use:
\(^O^) Baiii~ Hope to see you again soon!
* Initializes UI, storage and tasklist, and includes method for retrieving a response to user inputs.
* Loads user data from the specified file.
* @param filePath Path to the file used for storing and loading user data.
* Returns a response according to the raw user input string.
* Represents a command that adds a deadline task to the task list.
* A deadline task has a description and a due date/time, specified
* with the {@code /by} keyword in the user input.
* Constructs an AddDeadlineCommand with the specified user input.
* @param input The raw user string input.
* Executes the command by creating and adding a new deadline task.
* The task is stored in the task list and persisted to storage.
* @param userList Task list to which the new deadline is added.
* @param userStorage Storage manager to update with the new task.
* @param user UI manager to generate the response message.
* @return Response message confirming the addition of the deadline task.
* @throws JimbotException If the input is missing {@code /by},
public String execute(TaskList userList, Storage userStorage, UI user) throws JimbotException {
* Represents a command that adds an event task to the task list.
* An event task has a description, a start date/time, and an end date/time,
* specified with the {@code /from} and {@code /to} keywords in the user input.
* Constructs an AddEventCommand with the specified user input.
* @param input The raw user string input.
* Executes the command by creating and adding a new event task.
* The task is stored in the task list and persisted to storage.
* @param userList Task list to which the new event is added.
* @param userStorage Storage manager to update with the new task.
* @param user UI manager used to generate the response message.
* @return Response message confirming the addition of the event task.
* @throws InvalidEventException If the input is missing {@code /from}
* @throws InvalidDateTimeException If the {@code /to} time is before
* @throws JimbotException If other task-related errors occur.
public String execute(TaskList userList, Storage userStorage, UI user) throws JimbotException {
Event userEvent = new Event(description, dateTime1, dateTime2);
* Represents a command that adds a {@link ToDo} task to the task list.
* The description of the task is extracted from the user input
* This would create a new ToDo task with the description
* "read book" and add it to the task list.
* Constructs an AddToDoCommand with the specified user input.
* @param input The raw user string input.
* Executes the command by creating a new ToDo task and adding it
* to the task list. Updates storage and generates a confirmation
* @param userList Task list to which the new task will be added.
* @param userStorage Storage manager to update after adding the task.
* @param user UI manager used to generate the response message.
* @return Response message confirming the addition of the task.
* @throws InvalidToDoException If the description is empty.
* @throws JimbotException If an error occurs while updating the storage
public String execute(TaskList userList, Storage userStorage, UI user) throws JimbotException {
* Represents a command that clears the task list of all tasks.
* Executes the command by clearing the task list.
* The tasks are removed from task list and the storage is updated.
* @param userList Task list to be cleared.
* @param userStorage Storage manager to update after clearing.
* @param user UI manager used to generate the response message.
* @return Response message confirming deletion of the task.
* @throws EmptyListException If userList is empty already.
public String execute(TaskList userList, Storage userStorage, UI user) throws EmptyListException {
* Represents an executable command in Jimbot.
* Each concrete command class implements this interface to define its behavior.
String execute(TaskList userList, Storage userStorage, UI user) throws JimbotException;
* Indicates if this command should terminate the program.
* Default is false; ExitCommand overrides this.
* Represents the different commands that Jimbot can recognize.
* Provides a utility method to parse a string input into a Commands value.
// I used AI to find a way for me to implement both enums and commands.
// factory used to construct the command objects based on the command enums.
* Converts a string input and its extracted command word into a corresponding
* @param input User input string to be converted into a command.
* @return {@link Command} object corresponding to the user input.
public static Command fromString(String input) throws JimbotException {
* Represents a command that deletes a task from the task list.
* The task index is extracted from the user input following
* This would delete the second task in the task list.
* Constructs a DeleteCommand with the specified user input.
* @param input The raw user string input.
* Executes the command by deleting the task at the specified index.
* The task is removed from the task list and the storage is updated.
* @param userList Task list from which the task will be deleted.
* @param userStorage Storage manager to update after deletion.
* @param user UI manager used to generate the response message.
* @return Response message confirming deletion of the task.
* @throws JimbotException If the task index is invalid or other
public String execute(TaskList userList, Storage userStorage, UI user) throws JimbotException {
* Represents a command that terminates the program.
* The command returns a farewell message without changing anything.
* @param userStorage Storage manager (unused in this command).
* @param user UI manager used to generate the farewell message.
public String execute(TaskList userList, Storage userStorage, UI user) {
* Represents a command that searches for tasks containing a given keyword.
* This command looks through the task list for any task descriptions
* that match the specified search term, ignoring case sensitivity.
* The matching tasks are then returned in a formatted list.
* This would list all tasks whose description contains the word "book".
* Constructs a {@code FindCommand} with the given user input.
* @param input The raw user input string.
* @param userList The task list to search through.
* @param userStorage The storage manager (unused in this command).
* @param user The UI manager used to format and display results.
* @return A formatted string of all matching tasks.
* @throws NoSuchTaskException If there is no task in the list that matches the description.
* @throws EmptyListException If the list is empty.
public String execute(TaskList userList, Storage userStorage, UI user) throws JimbotException {
* Represents a command to find tasks scheduled on a specific date.
* If the user input is "today", tasks for the current date are returned.
* Otherwise, the input is parsed into a date and tasks on that date are returned.
* @param input User input string containing "today" or a date.
* Executes the find-date command by filtering tasks that occur
* @param userList Current task list of the user.
* @param userStorage Storage handler for persisting tasks.
* @param user UI component for formatting responses.
* @return A formatted string containing tasks that occur on the given date.
* @throws JimbotException If the date format is invalid.
public String execute(TaskList userList, Storage userStorage, UI user) throws JimbotException {
* Represents a command to greet the user.
* Returns a greeting message using the provided name.
* Executes the greet command by returning a greeting message.
* @param userList Current task list of the user (not used in this command).
* @param userStorage Storage handler for persisting tasks (not used in this command).
* @param user UI component for formatting responses.
* @return A greeting message for the user.
public String execute(TaskList userList, Storage userStorage, UI user) {
* Represents a command to display the list of available commands.
* Returns a formatted command list from the UI.
* Executes the help command by returning a list of all available commands.
* @param userList Current task list of the user (not used in this command).
* @param userStorage Storage handler for persisting tasks (not used in this command).
* @param user UI component for formatting responses.
* @return A string containing the list of available commands.
public String execute(TaskList userList, Storage userStorage, UI user) {
* Represents a command to display all tasks in the user's task list.
* Executes the list command by returning a formatted string of all tasks.
* @param userList Current task list of the user.
* @param userStorage Storage handler for persisting tasks (not used in this command).
* @param user UI component for formatting responses.
* @return A string representing all tasks in the user's task list.
public String execute(TaskList userList, Storage userStorage, UI user) throws EmptyListException {
* Represents a command to mark a specific task as done in the task list.
* Constructs a MarkCommand with the given user input.
* @param input Raw user input containing the command and task index.
* Executes the mark command by marking the specified task as done.
* @param userList The current list of tasks.
* @param userStorage The storage handler for persisting task changes.
* @param user The UI component used to generate formatted responses.
* @return A string confirming the task has been marked as done.
* @throws NoSuchTaskException If the task index is invalid or does not exist.
* @throws EmptyListException If the userlist is empty.
public String execute(TaskList userList, Storage userStorage, UI user) throws JimbotException {
* Represents a command to unmark a task as not done in the task list.
* The command identifies the task to unmark based on the user input.
* Constructs an UnmarkCommand with the specified user input.
* @param input Raw user input specifying which task to unmark.
* Executes the unmark operation on the specified task list.
* Marks the task at the given index as not done, updates the storage,
* and returns a formatted response message for the user.
* @param userList The task list on which the unmark operation is performed.
* @param userStorage The storage instance used to persist changes to tasks.
* @param user The UI instance used to generate the response message.
* @return A string message confirming the task has been unmarked.
* @throws NoSuchTaskException If the specified task index does not exist.
* @throws EmptyListException If the userList is empty.
public String execute(TaskList userList, Storage userStorage, UI user) throws JimbotException {

* the user list is called on but is empty.
* Constructs an EmptyList exception with the specified error message.
super("( ㄏ-᷅_-᷄)ㄏ You've nothing to " + command + "...");

* Represents an InvalidDeadline exception that occurs when an invalid Deadline format is given.
* Constructs an InvalidDeadline exception with the specified error message.
Invalid deadline format! Make sure you include /by (date/time)!!!
* Represents an InvalidEvent exception that occurs when an invalid Event format is given.
* Constructs an InvalidEvent exception with the specified error message.
* Represents an InvalidInput exception that occurs when the user inputs an unknown command.
* Constructs an InvalidInput exception with the specified error message.
super("Oops I don't recognize this command:\n"
* Represents an InvalidToDo exception that occurs when an empty ToDo command is given.
* Constructs an InvalidToDo exception with the specified error message.
* Represents exceptions specific to the Jimbot application.
* All custom exceptions should extend this class.
* Initializes a new JimbotException with the specified detail message.
* @param message Detail message describing the exception.
* Represents a NoSuchTask exception that occurs when an invalid task index is given.
* Constructs a NoSuchTask exception with the specified error message.
* Represents a TaskLimit exception that occurs when the number of task in the task list is more than 100.
* Constructs a TaskLimit exception with the specified error message.
* This class stores task data in hard disk.
* Represents a task with a deadline.
* Stores the date and time by which the task should be completed.
* Constructs a Deadline task with the specified description and due date
* @param by Date and time by which task is due.
assert by != null : "Deadline dateTime cannot be null";
: "Task description should not be null or empty";
* Returns a string representation of the Deadline task.
* Includes the task type, description, and formatted deadline.
* Shows only the date if the time is midnight; otherwise, shows date and time.
* @return String representation of the deadline task.
* Represents a task that occurs over a period of time.
* Stores the start and end date/time of the event.
* Constructs an Event task with the specified description, start, and end times.
* @param from Start date and time of the event.
* @param to End date and time of the event.
public Event(String description, LocalDateTime from, LocalDateTime to) {
assert description != null && !description.isEmpty() : "Event description cannot be null or empty";
assert from != null : "Event start time (from) cannot be null";
assert to != null : "Event end time (to) cannot be null";
assert !to.isBefore(from) : "Event end time cannot be before start time";

* Returns a string representation of the Event task.
* Includes the task type, description, and formatted start and end times.
* @return String representation of the event task.

* Provides methods to add, delete, retrieve, and search tasks.
* Constructs a new empty TaskList when there is no data stored.
* Constructs a TaskList with existing tasks loaded from storage.

assert loadTasks != null : "Task list cannot be null";
* Returns the list of tasks as a {@Link List<Task>}.
* @return List of tasks stored in this TaskList.
assert listOfTasks != null : "Internal task list should never be null";
* Adds a given task to the list.

* Retrieves a task from the list by index.

assert task != null : "Cannot delete null task from TaskList";
* Returns the number of tasks currently stored in the list.

* Sorts the tasks in the list chronologically.
* - Events are sorted by their start time.
* - Deadlines are sorted by their due time.
* - ToDos are placed after all dated tasks.
return 0; // both are ToDos, keep insertion order
return 1; // t1 is ToDo, push after t2
return -1; // t2 is ToDo, push after t1
* Returns the date/time used for sorting the task.
* @param task Task to get date/time for
* @return LocalDateTime for deadlines and events; null for ToDos
return null; // ToDos have no date/time
